title: Learning Object Utilization Strategies for Science Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific theories and fundamental instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Learners strengthen science curriculum design competencies and acquire efficient curriculum development methods using reusable learning objects (LOs). Integration with collaboration tools in BYOD environments is recommended

learning_goals: Design one customized science curriculum by leveraging metadata provided in the learning design framework.
Develop three or more learning objects that integrate theoretical knowledge (literature review) with practical cases (best practices).

Learners can analyze a peer-reviewed HR management curriculum (based on feedback from â‰¥5 peers) using three modularity metrics (time flexibility, content independence, scope of application) and two scalability metrics (applicability to other departments, industry-specific applicability), then submit a report presenting at least one concrete justification (e.g., case comparison, data analysis) per metric.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
